description.narrative: Output 5.1: Enhanced capacities of stakeholders at all levels, including communities, for increased learning opportunities for out- of-school children and young people, and equitable access for and retention of disadvantaged children., which contributes to Early Learning, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 5: By 2020, all boys and girls, including young people, have increased and more equitable access to, and completion of, quality, inclusive education, with improved learning outcomes.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 5.1: Enhanced capacities of stakeholders at all levels, including communities, for increased learning opportunities forout- of-school children and young people, and equitable access for and retention of disadvantaged children.

description.narrative: In 2021, UNICEF-supported School Improvement Grant disbursements were made to 4,795 disadvantaged schools (98.5% of targeted schools) benefitting 1,765,101 learners (888,398 boys and 876,703 girls).;The provision of assistive devices to 12,278 children with disabilities (7547 girls and 4631 boys) and the printing of the Open and Distance Learning Modules (benefiting 150,000 children) have increased the learning opportunities for children with disabilities and for in and out of school children. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:11/01/2022
